boat.name: Nell
boat.full_description:
'Nell' was commissioned by Robert Cowan Robertson from George Watson. Other yachts designed by him include 'Thistle', 'Valktie 2', 'Valktie 3' and 'Shamrock' for Sir Thomas Lipton, 'Meteor' for the German Emperor, and 'Britannia' for Edward, Prince of Wales.

Built by Thomas Orr at Greenock along the lines of a Loch Fyne skiff, 'Nell' was launched in Greenock on 23 June 1887. The interior is highly decorated and sliding stained glass windows mask the portholes. Prior to 1982, she was often seen in the Falmouth area as she was owned by Dion Erasmus and moored off Flushing.

In 1982, 'Nell' was the subject of a television documentary film by Lawrie Emberson and for a time formed part of the display of vessels at St Katherine's Dock, London. She was owned for a time by Neil Gamble of Teignmouth and was often to be seen in the River Teign in the 1960s. At that time she had a large wooden deckhouse.

She was spotted on the Hamble in 2010.
boat.construction_details: 1 1/2" Pitch pine on oak frames, copper sheathed.
boat.short_description: 'Nell' was built in 1887 to transport ministers around the Scottish islands which had no resident minister.
